intro: Satureja mimuloides, commonly known as mountain savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of the western United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are fragrant and often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported digestive and antiseptic properties. Satureja mimuloides thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy plant suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings.
